title: Afro Luffy is Luffy's Strongest Form
theory: A popular fan theory, existing somewhere between genuine discussion and meme culture, suggests that Afro Luffy is actually Luffy's most powerful form. The theory points to the fact that despite Foxy's tactical superiority and dirty tricks, Afro Luffy managed to overcome him. Some fans even joke about combining Afro Luffy with Gear 5 or Nightmare Luffy to create the 'ultimate form.' Usopp's claim that the afro awakens one's latent potential and the fact that Luffy did win while wearing it gives the theory some humorous credibility.
evidence: Luffy wins the Combat round while wearing the afro
Usopp's claim that the afro unlocks deepest latent powers
Cultural association between afros and champion boxers like Muhammad Ali
Afro Luffy has become one of the most iconic and beloved moments in One Piece

title: Long Ring Long Land is Laugh Tale
theory: Some fans theorize that Long Ring Long Land could actually be the legendary island of Laugh Tale where the One Piece treasure is hidden. The theory points to several suspicious coincidences: Usopp claiming to have the 'I'll-die-if-I-go-to-that-island' disease (which Buggy had before Roger reached Laugh Tale), Tonjit seemingly recognizing the crew despite never meeting them, and the island's cyclical appearance pattern similar to how Laugh Tale might only be accessible at certain times. The stretched nature of everything on the island could also be connected to Joy Boy/Nika and the concept of freedom.
evidence: Usopp's 'island disease' mirrors Buggy's before Roger reached Laugh Tale
Tonjit's mysterious recognition of the crew
The island only fully reveals itself once per year, similar to potential Laugh Tale access patterns
The stretched flora and fauna could be connected to Joy Boy's influence and the concept of 'freedom'
No one other than Roger Pirates knows where Laugh Tale is, so it could be somewhere already visited

title: Davy Back Fight Will Return for Luffy vs Shanks
theory: A popular theory suggests that the Davy Back Fight will return as the method for the Straw Hat Pirates and Red Hair Pirates to compete when they eventually meet. Since Luffy and Shanks have deep mutual respect but both aspire to be Pirate King, a Davy Back Fight would allow them to compete without malicious intent or requiring either to die. The Combat round format shown in Episode 217 (captain vs captain) would be the perfect way for Luffy to finally surpass and return the straw hat to Shanks. This could also feature interesting matchups like Usopp vs his father Yasopp in a marksmanship contest.
evidence: Luffy and Shanks' relationship makes traditional combat unlikely
Both crews are pursuing the title of Pirate King and will need to compete
The Davy Back Fight allows competition without ill-intent or death
Recent manga chapters (1155+) mention Davy Back Fights in Rocks' flashback, showing the concept's continued relevance
Oda rarely includes content without long-term purpose
Would allow crew member matchups like Usopp vs Yasopp

title: Joy Boy Visited Long Ring Long Land
theory: A theory connecting the Long Ring Long Land arc to the larger One Piece mythology suggests that Joy Boy visited the island at some point in the past, and his presence caused the stretched nature of the flora and fauna. The explanation ties to the concept of 'freedom' - animals and plants having so much freedom that they literally stretch. This connects to Luffy's Nika/Joy Boy powers and his representation of ultimate freedom, potentially foreshadowing Luffy's Gear 5 awakening where his body gains extreme stretching freedom beyond normal rubber properties.
evidence: The unexplained stretched nature of all life on the island
Connection between 'freedom' and stretching mirrors Luffy's Nika powers
Oda has shown that seemingly silly arcs often foreshadow major revelations (like Skypeia foreshadowing Gear 5)
The island's unique properties suggest special historical significance
Joy Boy's influence on the world appears in unexpected places

title: Foxy's Tactical Genius Foreshadows Future Opponents
theory: Some fans believe that Foxy's fighting style in the Combat round - using strategy, gadgets, and clever application of a seemingly weak Devil Fruit to nearly defeat Luffy - serves as foreshadowing for future opponents who will rely on tactics over raw power. The episode demonstrates that even with Luffy's growing strength, opponents who fight smart can still pose serious threats. This could be preparation for battles against characters like Doflamingo, Katakuri, or other strategically-minded villains.
evidence: Foxy's 920 consecutive Davy Back Fight wins show tactical superiority works
Luffy struggles significantly despite being physically stronger than Foxy
The Noro Noro no Mi's creative applications show 'weak' powers used cleverly can be devastating
Many future One Piece villains rely heavily on strategy and tactical fruit usage
The episode teaches Luffy (and viewers) that raw power isn't always enough
